question:
You have lost an item of value on a train. 


Write a letter to the railway company. In your letter


describe the item
explain where and when you left it
say what action you would like the company to take
Write at least 150 words.
text: My name is Steve Urkle and I am writing this letter to inform you about the loss of some personal belongings left on  train number X12Y that arrived from San Francisco last Friday at 10:00 in the evening.

I was travelling on the first wagon, and the item was forgotten under seat number 17E, next to the window. Concretely, it is a red solid Samsonite luggage and contains just some clothes and a purse with a gold engagement ring that has a great significance to me.

I would be very grateful if you can contact  the station staff in order to check if they have such objects in their Lost and Found section. Please do not hesitate in contacting me for any further information. Thanks in advance for your help and sorry for any other inconvenience that it may cause to you,
